basics.name: Curtis Frifeldt
basics.label: College Graduate
basics.summary: I recently graduated from the University of Hawaii at Manoa in Computer Engineering.  I am currently in the job market for a software developer position.

interests.name: Software Development, Internet Security, Internet of Things

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

highlights: Work with a project team to support maintenance on a nuclear submarine
Perform system checks and audits to ensure plant readiness for upcoming procedures
Read nuclear plant manuals and test instructions to show proficiency through discussion
Generate training briefing packages used to instruct ships force for upcoming procedures
Design a web application where UH Manoa students can create and view recipes
Front end: Designed using Semantic UI libraries with HTML/CSS
Back end: Developed with Meteor which uses Mongo DB and AngularJS
Design an agent-based computer simulation of disease propagation in a hospital setting
Program a movement script in NetLogo to match the activities of nurses working in an Intensive Care Unit
Implement a SIR model to track the infection state of agents in the simulation
Build and program an autonomous robot to find the center of a maze
Hardware: Construction of physical electric circuits through soldering and using PCBs
Software: Embedded systems software design, developed a basic control system to prevent collisions
Program an Arduino platform to interpret audio input with a led strip
Implement serial communication to run the led strip through a limited number of ports
Restrict memory consumption by using loops and functions
Ensure the safety of spectators and athletes by enforcing an established code of conduct
Attend to customer complaints with friendly customer service
Referred at local events to ensure adequate staffing
Assist in planning and execution of low-scale engineering social events

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Academic honor given to students with a 3.5 GPA or above

awards.title: Centennial Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to students who graduate high school with a minimum unweighted GPA of 3.8 or higher

awards.title: World Championship Finalists
awards.summary: My team (1973D) placed second amongst over 4000 teams at the 2012 VEX Robotics World Championships
